message_1: Suppose you want to send a secret message "MATH" using the One-time pad encryption technique. The message is converted into binary as follows: 01001101 01000001 01010100 01001000. You have a secret key "10101010 11110000 00110011 01010101" of the same length as the message. Using the XOR operation, encrypt the message and write the encrypted text.
message_2:
To encrypt the message using the One-time pad encryption technique, we need to perform the XOR operation between the binary representation of the message and the secret key. 

Message: 01001101 01000001 01010100 01001000
Key:     10101010 11110000 00110011 01010101

Perform XOR operation:

01001101 ⊕ 10101010 = 11100111
01000001 ⊕ 11110000 = 10110001
01010100 ⊕ 00110011 = 01100111
01001000 ⊕ 01010101 = 00011101

The encrypted message in binary is: 11100111 10110001 01100111 00011101
